questions.question: Which statement in rapid sequence intubation is incorrect ?

options.A: Preoxygenation with 100% oxygen for 3 minutes is done
options.C: It is the first choice of treatment in cardiac arrest patients
options.D: The induction agent and muscle relaxant are given simultaneously

questions.explanation: intubation (RSI) is not typically performed in cardiac arrest because such patients are usually unconscious, eliminating the need for an induction agent. Instead, bag-mask ventilation and immediate advanced airway placement are prioritized. RSI is primarily used in patients who require airway protection but are at risk of aspiration, not in cardiac arrest situations. Preoxygenation with 100% oxygen for 3 minutes is done (Option A) : This is correct. Preoxygenation is critical to ensure oxygen reserves during the apneic period of intubation. High–volume, low-pressure cuff is used (Option B) : This is correct. Such cuffs minimize the risk of airway trauma and provide an effective seal. The induction agent and muscle relaxant are given simultaneously (Option D) : This is correct. Administering these agents together minimizes the time to achieve intubation readiness. Reference: Miller’s Anaesthesia, 9th Edition, Page 1382

questions.question: An 18-year-old boy is rushed to the ER after having choked on a bone while eating. He is responsive but unable to speak. What is to be done next?

options.C: Deliver 5 back slaps and 5 chest compressions

questions.explanation: Correct Answer: D) Perform Heimlich maneuver Explanation: The patient is an adult who has choked on a bone while eating. The next best step is to perform the Heimlich maneuver by giving 5 abdominal thrusts. Heimlich Maneuver: The rescuer should stand or kneel behind the patient and wrap his arms around the patient's waist. With one hand, he makes a fist, and using the other hand, he drives the fist into the patient's abdomen with a rapid, forceful upward thrust to dislodge the foreign body. This is continued until the foreign body is expelled or if the patient becomes unresponsive. If the patient becomes unresponsive , immediately start CPR . Bag and mask ventilation (Option A): This intervention may be necessary if the patient becomes unresponsive and stops breathing, it is not the initial step in managing a conscious patient with an airway obstruction due to choking. Endoscopic removal(Option B): may be necessary if other methods fail or if the obstruction is not cleared by basic interventions, it may not be the initial step in managing a conscious patient with a clear airway obstruction. Deliver 5 back slaps and 5 chest compressions (Option C): This is done in the case of an infant and not an adult. Reference: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK531467/
